Package com.arbergashi.charts.model

package com.arbergashi.charts.model
Data model layer for ArberCharts.

Provides zero-allocation models for financial, medical, and analytical data. Implementations often expose primitive arrays and require consumers to respect getPointCount().

Thread-safety: Several models support lock-free reads with concurrent writers; each model documents its own guarantees and limits. See docs/CONCURRENCY_MODEL.md for core semantics.

Since:
2026-01-30
Version:
1.7.0
Author:
Arber Gashi

    FlowChartModel
    An extension of ChartModel for flow-based data, such as that required by Sankey or Alluvial diagrams.
    FlowChartModel.Link
    Represents a link (or edge) in the flow diagram.
    FlowChartModel.Node
    Represents a node in the flow diagram.
    HierarchicalChartModel<T>
    An extension of ChartModel for hierarchical data structures, such as those required by Sunburst or Treemap charts.
    HierarchicalChartModel.Node<T>
    Represents a node in the hierarchical data structure.
    HierarchicalDataPoint
    Represents a node in a hierarchical data structure, used for charts like Sunburst or Treemaps.
    MatrixChartModel
    An extension of ChartModel for matrix-based data, such as that required by Chord Diagrams or adjacency matrices.
    MultiDimensionalChartModel
    An extension of ChartModel for multi-dimensional data, where each data point is an array of values.
    MultiVariateChartModel
    An extension of ChartModel for multivariate data, where each data point consists of multiple values across different dimensions.
    MultiVariateChartModel.MultiVariatePoint
    Represents a single data item in a multivariate dataset.
    OHLCBar
    Type-safe OHLC data point for financial charts.
    ProvenanceFlags
    Provenance flags for per-point audit metadata.
    SignalChartModel
    Specialized model for high-frequency signal data (medical/telemetry).
    StatisticalChartModel
    Specialized statistical model for distributions and quantiles.
    TernaryChartModel
    An extension of ChartModel for 3-component data, required for Ternary Plots.
    TernaryChartModel.TernaryPoint
    Represents a single 3-component data point.
